poem:
The Grid  
   
Clues crisscross, an unknown  
landscape of words entangled,  
each square a mystery, silent  
as the pews in a stone church.  
One fills slowly, enlightenment  
through letters; a solitary  
wrestle with structure, logic,  
and the whispers of lexicons  
hidden in the shadowed corners  
of the mind, a prayer to unravel.
